bullet_summary: Reported by Al Jazeera, France24

items.title: Ultra-Orthodox Jews rally in Israel against military service
items.standfirst: Ultra-Orthodox Jews brought West Jerusalem to a standstill to protest plans to draft them into the Israeli army.
items.content: Ultra-Orthodox Jews brought West Jerusalem to a standstill to protest plans to draft them into the Israeli army.

items.title: Israel’s ultra-Orthodox rally in ‘March of the Million’ against army service
items.standfirst: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox men packed the entrance to Jerusalem on Thursday, protesting government plans to draft them into the military. Chanting and waving signs saying they would rather go to jail, demonstrators highlighted a growing rift over exemptions that threatens Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.
items.content: Tens of thousands of ultra-Orthodox men packed the entrance to Jerusalem on Thursday, protesting government plans to draft them into the military. Chanting and waving signs saying they would rather go to jail, demonstrators highlighted a growing rift over exemptions that threatens Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.

ai_summary: Ultra-Orthodox Jews rallied in West Jerusalem to protest military draft plans.
Protesters demonstrated against plans to draft them into the Israeli army.
Demonstrators chanted and held signs indicating a preference for jail.
The protests highlighted a growing rift over exemptions from military service.
The exemptions threaten Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.

clusters.title: Furloughed federal workers are taking out loans to help pay the bills
clusters.neutral_headline: Federal Workers Face Financial Strain During Government Shutdown
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, Wired

items.title: Furloughed federal workers are taking out loans to help pay the bills
items.standfirst: Federal workers are turning to low-cost loans to help tide them over financially as the U.S. government shutdown drags on.
items.content: Federal workers are turning to low-cost loans to help tide them over financially as the U.S. government shutdown drags on.

items.title: Federal Workers Are Barely Making It Through the Government Shutdown
items.standfirst: The US government shut down 30 days ago. WIRED spoke with more than a dozen federal workers who have struggled to pay bills, worked side gigs, and relied on free food programs to get by.
items.content: The US government shut down 30 days ago. WIRED spoke with more than a dozen federal workers who have struggled to pay bills, worked side gigs, and relied on free food programs to get by.

ai_summary: Federal workers are taking out loans to pay bills during the shutdown.
The U.S. government shutdown has lasted for approximately thirty days.
Many federal workers are struggling to pay their bills.
Some federal workers are working side gigs to earn income.
Some federal workers are relying on free food programs.

clusters.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Família becomes world's tallest church
clusters.neutral_headline: Barcelona's Sagrada Família Becomes World's Tallest Church
bullet_summary: 91 metres (534ft 8in) above the city, the church said in a statement
Reported by BBC World, Guardian World

items.title: Barcelona's Sagrada Família becomes world's tallest church
items.standfirst: The Gaudí-designed architectural marvel now stands at an impressive 162.91 metres.
items.content: The Gaudí-designed architectural marvel now stands at an impressive 162.91 metres.

items.title: Four feet higher and rising: Barcelona’s Sagrada Familia becomes world’s tallest church
items.standfirst: Antoni Gaudí’s masterwork is still under construction but now stands taller than Ulm Minster in southern GermanyBarcelona’s Sagrada Familia basilica became the world’s tallest church on Thursday after a part of its central tower was lifted into place.The masterwork of the architect Antoni Gaudí now rises to 162.91 metres (534ft 8in) above the city, the church said in a statement. That beats the spire of Ulm Minster in Germany, which tops out at 161.53 metres. Continue reading...
items.content: Antoni Gaudí’s masterwork is still under construction but now stands taller than Ulm Minster in southern GermanyBarcelona’s Sagrada Familia basilica became the world’s tallest church on Thursday after a part of its central tower was lifted into place.The masterwork of the architect Antoni Gaudí now rises to 162.91 metres (534ft 8in) above the city, the church said in a statement. That beats the spire of Ulm Minster in Germany, which tops out at 161.53 metres. Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Sagrada Família in Barcelona is now the world's tallest church.
The church is a Gaudí-designed architectural marvel.
The church now stands at 162.91 meters tall.
The church's height surpasses Ulm Minster in Germany.
The church is still under construction.

clusters.title: Trump caps refugee admissions at record low - with most to be white South Africans
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Sets Record Low for Refugee Admissions
bullet_summary: Reported by BBC World, France24

items.title: Trump caps refugee admissions at record low - with most to be white South Africans
items.standfirst: The president sets the limit at 7,500 for the coming year, a dramatic cut from 125,000.
items.content: The president sets the limit at 7,500 for the coming year, a dramatic cut from 125,000.

items.title: Trump caps refugee admissions to record low, prioritising white South Africans
items.standfirst: The Trump administration on Thursday said it would slash the number of refugees admitted to the United States to a record low of 7,500 for fiscal year 2026, down from more than 100,000 under president Joe Biden, while prioritising applicants from white South African communities.
items.content: The Trump administration on Thursday said it would slash the number of refugees admitted to the United States to a record low of 7,500 for fiscal year 2026, down from more than 100,000 under president Joe Biden, while prioritising applicants from white South African communities.

ai_summary: The Trump administration will slash refugee admissions to a record low.
The limit for refugee admissions is set at 7,500 for fiscal year 2026.
This is a significant decrease from over 100,000 under President Biden.
The administration will prioritize applicants from white South African communities.
The decision was announced on Thursday.

clusters.title: SNAP funding is set to lapse Saturday. Here's what to know.
clusters.neutral_headline: SNAP Funding Set to Lapse, Raising Questions
bullet_summary: Reported by CBS News, Wired

items.title: SNAP funding is set to lapse Saturday. Here's what to know.
items.standfirst: With food-stamp funding set to lapse Saturday, recipients are asking what happens to their benefits — and when help might resume.
items.content: With food-stamp funding set to lapse Saturday, recipients are asking what happens to their benefits — and when help might resume.

items.title: No, SNAP Benefits Aren’t Mostly Used by Immigrants
items.standfirst: SNAP benefits are set to run out on Saturday. Far-right influencers and extremists are incorrectly claiming that immigrants are the main recipients of food stamps.
items.content: SNAP benefits are set to run out on Saturday. Far-right influencers and extremists are incorrectly claiming that immigrants are the main recipients of food stamps.

ai_summary: SNAP funding is set to expire on Saturday.
Recipients are asking about the status of their benefits.
Recipients are also asking when help might resume.
Far-right influencers are incorrectly claiming immigrants are main recipients.
SNAP benefits are not primarily used by immigrants.

clusters.title: Senate passes bill to nullify Trump’s sweeping global tariffs on more than 100 nations – as it happened
clusters.neutral_headline: Senate Rejects Trump's Global Tariffs; Trump Threatens Nuclear Testing
bullet_summary: In a post to Truth Social, Trump said “because of other countries’ testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis
Reported by Guardian World, Guardian Business

items.title: Senate passes bill to nullify Trump’s sweeping global tariffs on more than 100 nations – as it happened
items.standfirst: This live blog is now closed.Trump news at a glance: Four Senate Republicans join Democrats to reject global tariffsIn the days leading up to the Trump-Xi meeting, American officials signalled that the US president did not intend to make good on a recent threat to impose an additional 100% import tax on Chinese goods.Also that China had shown signs it is willing to relax its export controls on rare earths as well as revive buying soybeans from the US.The relationship with China is very good.Because of the tremendous destructive power, I HATED to do it, but had no choice! Russia is second, and China is a distant third, but will be even within 5 years.Because of other countries testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately. Continue reading...
items.content: This live blog is now closed.Trump news at a glance: Four Senate Republicans join Democrats to reject global tariffsIn the days leading up to the Trump-Xi meeting, American officials signalled that the US president did not intend to make good on a recent threat to impose an additional 100% import tax on Chinese goods.Also that China had shown signs it is willing to relax its export controls on rare earths as well as revive buying soybeans from the US.The relationship with China is very good.Because of the tremendous destructive power, I HATED to do it, but had no choice! Russia is second, and China is a distant third, but will be even within 5 years.Because of other countries testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately. Continue reading...

items.title: US Senate votes to reject Trump’s global tariffs on more than 100 countries
items.standfirst: Vote passes 51-47 in latest bipartisan effort to challenge tariffs, but House is unlikely to take any similar actionThe US Senate took a stand against Donald Trump’s global tariffs affecting more than 100 countries on Thursday, voting to nullify the so-called “reciprocal” tariffs.Four Republicans joined with all Democrats to vote 51-47 on a resolution to end the base-level tariffs that the president put into place via executive order. Continue reading...
items.content: Vote passes 51-47 in latest bipartisan effort to challenge tariffs, but House is unlikely to take any similar actionThe US Senate took a stand against Donald Trump’s global tariffs affecting more than 100 countries on Thursday, voting to nullify the so-called “reciprocal” tariffs.Four Republicans joined with all Democrats to vote 51-47 on a resolution to end the base-level tariffs that the president put into place via executive order. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump directs Pentagon to match Russia and China in nuclear weapons testing
items.standfirst: US president makes threat after Russian nuclear-powered weapons tests and shortly before meeting with Chinese leaderDonald Trump has instructed the Pentagon to immediately start matching other nuclear powers in their testing of nuclear weapons, specifically citing Russia and China.In a post to Truth Social, Trump said “because of other countries’ testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president makes threat after Russian nuclear-powered weapons tests and shortly before meeting with Chinese leaderDonald Trump has instructed the Pentagon to immediately start matching other nuclear powers in their testing of nuclear weapons, specifically citing Russia and China.In a post to Truth Social, Trump said “because of other countries’ testing programs, I have instructed the Department of War to start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis. That process will begin immediately.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: The Senate passed a bill to nullify Trump's global tariffs.
Four Republicans joined Democrats to reject the tariffs.
Trump instructed the Pentagon to match nuclear weapons testing.
Trump cited Russia and China as examples for nuclear testing.
The Senate vote was 51-47.

items.content: Hurricane Melissa, which made landfall in Jamaica and Cuba this week, followed what has become a familiar pattern for major storms as the climate changes.
